* either itâ€™s an admin choice, and then all accounts are either encrypted or not, and have password recovery or not.
* or itâ€™s a user choice, and then you first have to _opt in_ to encryption.

because this scenario here seems quite strange, where users are basically confronted with: â»hey, you can come on this server, and your data will be encrypted and safe, but when you forget your password all will be lost. if you donâ€™t want to risk that you can give the admin a means of resetting the password. thatâ€™s a potential backdoor, but it still gives protection against other parties â€“ and if you trust your admin everything should be fine.â«

seems strange to me, hence iâ€™d say both decisions should be done at the same point â€“ either both in the admin settings, or both in the personal settings. admins would have an option to say every user can opt in on their own. but already opting them in to encryption and then just leaving them with the choice about how to cope with security is a subpar solution here.
